wikipedia_page.main: Joyce Reason (December 1894 - 18 September 1974) was a British author of missionary biographies and historical fiction for young readers.

response: * Joyce Reason. The man who disappeared: Sundar Singh of India. London: Edinburgh House Press, 1937
*Joyce Reason, Safety last: The story of Albert Cook of Uganda. London: Highway Press, 1954.  ASIN B0000CJ1DK
*Joyce Reason, The Witch of Ningpo (Eagle Books, No. 30.) London: Edinburgh House Press, 1940
* Joyce Reason, Griffith John of China: A biography (Eagle Books, London, 1950)
Joyce Reason. The Bricklayer and the King: Henry Nott of the South Seas. London, Edinburgh House, 1938.
*Joyce Reason, Take My Life: Ruatoka of Papua. London: Edinburgh House Press, 1947
Hazel Reason remained unmarried. She lived in Guildford with her sister, the writer Joyce Reason, for much of her life.
* Joyce Reason, Go and Find It!: Kendall Gale of Madagascar. London: Edinburgh House Press, 1942.
* Joyce Reason, Storm over Madagascar: David Jones. London: Carrgate Press, 1937.
